item.title: US election 2020: Trump in three-state campaign blitz after casting vote
item.description: The US president's frenetic schedule saw him visiting three key states in one day after voting in Florida.

item.title: Dr Fauci: Covid vaccine could come by end of 2020
item.description: The US government scientist says we should know if a vaccine is "safe and effective" by December.

item.title: France recalls Turkey envoy after Erdogan says Macron needs 'mental check'
item.description: France recalls its ambassador after President Erdogan suggests French leader needs "mental check".

item.title: Nuclear weapons treaty: Campaigners hail new era for nuclear disarmament
item.description: A 50th nation ratifies a key UN treaty and it will come into force - but five major powers are missing.

item.title: 'Murder hornet': First nest found in US eradicated with vacuum hose
item.description: The Asian giant hornets can wipe out a colony of honeybees in hours.

item.title: Joan Hocquard: Oldest person in Britain dies aged 112
item.description: Joan Hocquard, who drove ambulances during World War Two, died at a care home on Saturday.

item.title: Nigeria protests: Police chief deploys 'all resources' amid street violence
item.description: The shooting of unarmed protesters earlier this week sparked the worst street violence seen in two decades.

item.title: Samsung Group titan Lee Kun-hee dies aged 78
item.description: Mr Lee helped to grow his father's small trading business into a global industrial powerhouse.

item.title: Europe's streets empty again
item.description: With infections rising across Europe, tighter Covid restrictions are being enforced.

item.title: Adele sings and jokes about weight loss as she hosts Saturday Night Live
item.description: The star also tells the audience "my album's not finished" as she presents the US sketch show.

item.title: Post-Brexit trade talks extended, says No 10
item.description: No 10 confirms the EU's Michel Barnier will stay in London, rather than returning to Brussels later.

item.title: Misty Copeland: Ballet’s listening after George Floyd
item.description: Radio 1 Newsbeat hears from dancers about how the Black Lives Matter movement has changed ballet.

item.title: Seychelles election: Wavel Ramkalawan in landmark win
item.description: The opposition wins the presidency for the first time since independence from the UK.

item.title: Afghan bombing: Kabul education centre attack kills at least 24
item.description: The suicide attack outside the private facility in the Afghan capital has wounded dozens more.

item.title: Emotional UFC champion announces retirement
item.description: Lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov retires from the UFC after beating Justin Gaethje in the second round in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Socially-distanced Sesame Street calms children's Covid fears
item.description: The Middle East's version of Sesame street, 'Ahlam Simsim', hopes Muppets will help calm children's Covid fears.

item.title: Mario Kart Live: Mixed-reality karts race around the home
item.description: Nintendo reveals a mixed-reality version of its top-selling game, but is it more than a gimmick?

item.title: Dussehra: Covid-19 forces grand Hindu festival to go online
item.description: The pandemic has interrupted a centuries-old Indian tradition, the yearly performance of an ancient Hindu epic.

item.title: Osiris-Rex: Nasa probe risks losing asteroid sample after door jams
item.description: The Osiris-Rex spacecraft collected so much rock from asteroid Bennu that bits are leaking out.

item.title: Covid blood plasma donation: What is blood plasma?
item.description: The NHS wants us to donate blood plasma to help fight Covid-19. But why?

item.title: ICYMI: The puppy born green and other curiosities
item.description: Our weekly video round-up, In Case You Missed It, brings you some of the stories that might have passed you by.

item.title: Colorado fires: 'It's devastating... watching my community burn'
item.description: The Colorado wildfires have forced teacher CarrieAnn Fain to leave behind her dream home.

item.title: Week in pictures: 17-23 October 2020
item.description: A selection of striking images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Brothers play tabla to the BBC theme tune
item.description: Ryan and Isaac have been playing the tabla, traditional drums, since they were young.

item.title: The Countdown: Ariana Grande and early voting for astronauts
item.description: Just after the debate ended, Ariana Grande dropped a video and it put her in the White House.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh: The three-year-old orphaned by war
item.description: Hadija’s mum, dad and older sister were killed in the Azerbaijaini town of Ganja.

item.title: Composer with dementia whose piano-playing went viral meets students he inspired
item.description: Eighty-year-old Paul Harvey went viral after he was filmed playing piano pieces learned decades ago.

item.title: Quest Sprout: 'The most wholesome thing on the internet'
item.description: Among the horrors of 2020, one small green hero has emerged to bring brief moments of joy.

item.title: Coronavirus: Chester drive-in movie bogged down by lockdown loos
item.description: Movie-goers cannot cross the Welsh border to use toilet facilities at the drive-in cinema.

item.title: Why Nigerian protesters want Beyoncé to be more like Rihanna
item.description: Beyoncé said she wanted to help the anti-police brutality protesters but some were not impressed.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 16 - 22 October 2020
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: Coronavirus: Inside Europe’s most infected area
item.description: Gavin Lee reports from the epicentre of the second wave of the Covid-19 pandemic, which is in Belgium.

item.title: My search for novelist Rumer Godden's famed French summer
item.description: Hugh Schofield looks for the truth behind Rumer Godden's The Greengage Summer in northern France.

item.title: A child of 9/11 who won't be pressured to vote
item.description: Natalia Jones-Pinkney is an undecided voter - which has a lot to do with her experience of 9/11 as a child.

item.title: US election 2020: What we can learn from Trump and Biden's musical choices
item.description: From Tina Turner to Stevie Wonder, what do we learn from Trump and Biden's musical choices?

item.title: 'Not just numbers': The women disappearing in Peru
item.description: Thousands of women go missing in Peru every year and many are never found.

item.title: British-bred Royal Enfield speeding ahead in Asia
item.description: One of the world's oldest motorbike brands is expanding in Asia, the biggest market for two-wheelers.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh conflict: 'Execution' video prompts war crime probe
item.description: A video posted on social media appears to show the execution of two Armenian prisoners by troops from Azerbaijan.

item.title: The man who taught Uber how to say sorry
item.description: Economist John List had a bad ride with Uber and never got an apology, so he showed them the best way to do it.

item.title: How the End Sars protests have changed Nigeria forever
item.description: The campaign against police brutality has encouraged young Nigerians to take on the older generation.

item.title: 'It feels so good to be back dancing'
item.description: The world of ballroom dancing went online to cope with the pandemic restrictions, but what does the future hold?

item.title: United Nations at 75 plagued by new crises and cash crunch
item.description: Faced with wars, climate change and a pandemic, the United Nations is struggling to make an impact.

item.title: Chile's choice: Out with the old, in with the new?
item.description: After a year of often violent protests, Chileans get to decide whether they want a new constitution.

item.title: The Indian doctor taking care of thousands of elephants
item.description: Kushal Konwar Sarma is affectionately known as the "elephant doctor" in India's wildlife community.

item.title: Covid: Why is coronavirus so deadly?
item.description: Why does the biology of coronavirus mean it poses such a threat to human life?

item.title: 'It is only used to make decisions against Barca' - Koeman blames VAR for Clasico loss
item.description: Ronald Koeman says the VAR system is "only used to make decisions against Barcelona" as Sergio Ramos' penalty helps Real Madrid win El Clasico.

item.title: Manchester United 0-0 Chelsea: Hosts' season 'delicately poised' after stalemate
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is determined to avoid a repeat of the disastrous slide in fortunes Manchester United experienced following their win against Paris St-Germain in 2019.

item.title: 'I love these games. You earn the easier games on nights like these'
item.description: Jurgen Klopp says his Liverpool side "had to work hard" to preserve their unbeaten run at Anfield as they fought back to beat Sheffield United.

item.title: Pep Guardiola: Man City boss facing a rebuilding job - Keown
item.description: After a slow start to the season and more injuries, is this Pep Guardiola's biggest test in his four years at Manchester City?

item.title: All you need to know for Portuguese GP: Hamilton on the brink of history
item.description: Lewis Hamilton often out-drives Valtteri Bottas, but on Saturday he out-thought the Finn to close in on a big milestone.

item.title: Rays level World Series with win in final play of game four
item.description: The Tampa Bay Rays level the World Series after clinching a dramatic 8-7 win against the Los Angeles Dodgers in the final play of game four.

item.title: Kamala Harris: What her experience tell us about US politics
item.description: What Kamala Harris' experiences tell us about US politics.

item.title: Predict the president 2020: Will Trump or Biden win the US election? You decide
item.description: Play our game to predict whether Donald Trump or Joe Biden will win the key states in the election.

item.title: US election 2020: How Trump has changed the world
item.description: From fake news to how other countries see the US - here's a look at the president's global impact.

item.title: US election 2020: What are Trump's and Biden's policies?
item.description: Some of President Trump's and Joe Biden's key policies explained and compared.

item.title: US election 2020 polls: Who is ahead - Trump or Biden?
item.description: An in-depth look at the polls and what they can and can’t tell us about who will win the White House.

item.title: US election 2020: How will early voting impact the election?
item.description: A record number of people have already cast their votes - so how will this impact the election?

item.title: George Floyd death: A city pledged to abolish its police. Then what?
item.description: Minneapolis has struggled to keep a promise that made global headlines after George Floyd's death.

item.title: Electoral College: Which voters really decide the US election?
item.description: More than 245 million Americans are eligible to vote but only a few will decide the outcome.

item.title: Presidential debate 2020: Why Abraham Lincoln starred in the final clash
item.description: Trump's comparison of himself with the 16th president on race issues draws Biden's mockery.

item.title: Moderator Kristen Welker named 'clear winner'
item.description: The NBC correspondent is labelled "clear winner" for the way she led the final presidential debate.

item.title: Presidential debate: Decoding Trump and Biden's body language
item.description: A body language expert gives her view on the presidential rivals' final live TV debate.

item.title: What voters made of the encounter
item.description: Two Biden voters. Two Trump voters. Two undecided voters. Did the final debate change anyone's mind?

item.title: US President Donald Trump at debate: Look at India. The air is filthy
item.description: President Trump's 'filthy air' remark drew both anger and introspection from Indians.

item.title: Presidential debate: Trump and Biden spar in final showdown
item.description: Their last time together on stage featured a much more subdued debate with real policy discussions.

item.title: Tanzania President John Magufuli: The man who declared victory over coronavirus
item.description: President John Magufuli’s idiosyncratic handling of Covid-19 has put Tanzania in the global spotlight.

item.title: Covid-19: How restaurants are preparing for winter
item.description: Why restaurant owners hope outdoor heaters and marquees might help keep customers coming back.

item.title: Eating jellyfish: Why scientists are talking up a 'perfect food'
item.description: Amid fresh concern about overfishing, scientists say eating more jellyfish may give us benefits.

item.title: Thailand protest: Why young activists are embracing Hong Kong's tactics
item.description: Thailand’s activists are increasingly adopting methods used last year by demonstrators in Hong Kong.

item.title: Will cruise ships return to Venice?
item.description: Pressure is mounting on the Italian authorities to decide on the future of cruise ships in Venice.

item.title: 'I'm Bengali, my boyfriend was black - and my mum freaked out'
item.description: Salma left home when her family urged her to get an abortion. Later she challenged her mum's anti-black prejudice.

item.title: Covid: What the tier rules say about the split between science and politics
item.description: Why does the divergence between science and politics appear to be wider than it has ever been?
